Global Namespace

-Namespaces
vsip

All VSIPL++ interfaces live in namespace c vsip.

vsip_csl

VSIP_IMPL_TUNE_MODE

-

Setting TUNE_MODE to 1 disables the tunable_thresholds.

More...

Setting TUNE_MODE to 1 disables the tunable_thresholds. This allows benchmarks to be run without thresholds to determine cross-over points, which can then be used as thresholds.

VSIP_MAX_DIMENSION

The maximum number of dimensions supported by this implementation.

VSIP_IMPL_NORETURN

-

If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions with an indication that they never return (except possibly by throwing an exception), then VSIP_NORETURN is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to nothing.

More...

If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions with an indication that they never return (except possibly by throwing an exception), then VSIP_NORETURN is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to nothing. GCC supports it, as does Green Hills, as well as Intel. The latter defines __GNUC__, too.

VSIP_IMPL_NOINLINE

-

If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions with an indication that they should not be inlined, then VSIP_IMPL_NOINLINE is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to nothing.

More...

If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions with an indication that they should not be inlined, then VSIP_IMPL_NOINLINE is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to nothing.

Greenhills does not use this attribute.

VSIP_IMPL_FLATTEN

If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions that every call inside the function should be inlined, then VSIP_IMPL_FLATTEN is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to nothing.

PRAGMA_IVDEP

Loop vectorization pragmas.

PRAGMA_VECTOR_ALWAYS
VSIP_NOTHROW

-

When set to non-zero, the implementation will throw exceptions as required by the specification.

More...

When set to non-zero, the implementation will throw exceptions as required by the specification. When set to zero, exceptions will not be thrown. Instead, whenever the implementation would have thrown an exception, it will instead print a diagnostic to cerr and call abort(). FUTURE: Mode in which exceptional conditions are not detected at all.

VSIP_IMPL_PROFILE_FEATURE

-

The profiling of specific areas of the library is a feature which can be enabled in each module using this macro.

More...

The profiling of specific areas of the library is a feature which can be enabled in each module using this macro. A second macro, defined in the module itself, must be set prior to using this.

VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION

Since all Permutor partial specializations differ only in the permutation chosen, we use a macro to carry all the repeated text.

VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR

Macro to define a unary function on views in terms of its homologe on scalars.

VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR_RETN
VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH
VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION
VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_VIEW_FUNCTION

-

This function gateway is roughly specialized to VSIPL++ view types.

More...

This function gateway is roughly specialized to VSIPL++ view types. This prevents it from competing with more general function overloads. For example, cmath defines template <typename T> bool isnan(T& t) which is ambiguous with the normal VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION.

VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OP

Define a unary operator.

More...

Define a unary operator. Assume the associated Dispatch is already defined.
